subject: Investing
title: International ETFs and Index Funds
description: A fast breakdown of International ETFs and Index Funds for builders.

hook.text: One $50 ETF purchase gave an investor exposure to over 8,000 stocks across 47 countries.

buildup.text: International ETFs track indexes covering developed markets (EAFE), emerging markets (EM), or the total world (ACWI).

discovery.text: Vanguard's VXUS, iShares' IXUS, and Schwab's SCHY offer broad international exposure at very low fees.

twist.text: Total-world funds like VT include the US, so check for overlap if you already own a domestic index fund.

climax.text: For most investors, a single international ETF provides all the global diversification they need.

punchline.text: Global investing used to require a team and millions. Now it takes one ETF and $50.

quiz.question: What does the MSCI ACWI index cover?
